filesystem

Class File

  • java.lang.Object
    • filesystem.FileSystemObject
      • filesystem.File

  • public class File
extends FileSystemObject
    A class of files.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Tim Lauwers, Tim Robensyn, Robbe Van Biervliet
    Invariants:
  • Each file must have a valid size.
        isValidSize(getSize())
  • The file type of each file must be a valid file type for any file.
        isValidType(getType())

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int maximumSize
      Variable registering the maximum size of any file (in bytes).
      private int size
      Variable registering the size of this file (in bytes).
      private FileType type
      Variable registering the type of this file.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      File(Directory dir, String name, FileType type)
      Initialize a new file with given parent directory, name and type that is empty and writable.
      File(Directory dir, String name, int size, boolean writable, FileType type)
      Initialize a new file with given parent directory, name, size, writability and type.
      File(String name, FileType type)
      Initialize a new root file with given name and type that is empty and writable.
      File(String name, int size, boolean writable, FileType type)
      Initialize a new root file with given name, size, writability and type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • File

        public File(Directory dir,
            String name,
            int size,
            boolean writable,
            FileType type)
        Initialize a new file with given parent directory, name, size, writability and type.
        Parameters:
        dir - The parent directory of the new file.
        name - The name of the new file.
        size - The size of the new file.
        writable - The writability of the new file.
        type - The file type of the new file.
        Precondition:
        The type is effective
            type != null
        Postcondition:
        The new file has the given type as its file type.
            new.getType() == type
        Effects:
      • The new file is a file system object with given parent directory, name and writability.
            super(dir,name,writable)
      • The new file has the given size as its size.
            setSize(size)

      • File

        public File(Directory dir,
            String name,
            FileType type)
        Initialize a new file with given parent directory, name and type that is empty and writable.
        Parameters:
        dir - The parent directory of the new file.
        name - The name of the new file.
        type - The file type of the new file.
        Effect:
        The new file is initialized with the given parent directory, name and type, a zero size and true writability.
            this(dir,name,0,true,type)

      • File

        public File(String name,
            int size,
            boolean writable,
            FileType type)
        Initialize a new root file with given name, size, writability and type.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new file.
        size - The size of the new file.
        writable - The writability of the new file.
        type - The file type of the new file.
        Effect:
        The new root file is initialized with the given name, size, writability, type and no parent directory.
            this(null,name,size,writable,type)

      • File

        public File(String name,
            FileType type)
        Initialize a new root file with given name and type that is empty and writable.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new file.
        type - The file type of the new file.
        Effect:
        The new root file is initialized with the given name and type, a zero size and true writability.
            this(null,name,0,true,type)

      • getType

        @Basic
 @Immutable
public FileType getType()
        Return the type of this file.

      • isValidType

        @Raw
public static boolean isValidType(FileType type)
        Check whether this type is a valid file type for all files.
        Parameters:
        type - The file type to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given type is effective
            result ==
              (type != null)

      • getSize

        @Raw
 @Basic
public int getSize()
        Return the size of this file (in bytes).

      • setSize

        @Raw
 @Model
private void setSize(int size)
        Set the size of this file to the given size.
        Parameters:
        size - The new size for this file.
        Precondition:
        The given size must be legal.
            isValidSize(size)
        Postcondition:
        The given size is registered as the size of this file.
            new.getSize() == size

      • getMaximumSize

        @Basic
 @Immutable
public static int getMaximumSize()
        Return the maximum file size.

      • isValidSize

        public static boolean isValidSize(int size)
        Check whether the given size is a valid size for a file.
        Parameters:
        size - The size to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given size is positive and does not exceed the maximum size.
            result == ((size >= 0) && (size <= getMaximumSize()))

      • enlarge

        public void enlarge(int delta)
             throws ObjectNotWritableException
        Increases the size of this file with the given delta.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount of bytes by which the size of this file must be increased.
        Precondition:
        The given delta must be strictly positive.
            delta > 0
        Effect:
        The size of this file is increased with the given delta.
            changeSize(delta)
        Throws:
        ObjectNotWritableException

      • shorten

        public void shorten(int delta)
             throws ObjectNotWritableException
        Decreases the size of this file with the given delta.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount of bytes by which the size of this file must be decreased.
        Precondition:
        The given delta must be strictly positive.
            delta > 0
        Effect:
        The size of this file is decreased with the given delta.
            changeSize(-delta)
        Throws:
        ObjectNotWritableException

      • changeSize

        @Model
private void changeSize(int delta)
                         throws IllegalStateException,
                                ObjectNotWritableException
        Change the size of this file with the given delta.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount of bytes by which the size of this file must be increased or decreased.
        Precondition:
        The given delta must not be 0
            delta != 0
        Effects:
      • The size of this file is adapted with the given delta.
            setSize(getSize()+delta)
      • The modification time is updated.
            setModificationTime()
        • Throws:
        IllegalStateException - This file is terminated. | isTerminated()
        ObjectNotWritableException(this) - This file is not writable. | ! isWritable()
        ObjectNotWritableException
